Meetings.Raw:
DEMONSTRATION AT KING'S HALL, COVENT GARDEN
IN CONNECTION WITH THE SUFFRAGE SCHOOL,
SUNDAY, JANUARY 4, 8 p.m.
SPEAKERS: Miss SYLVIA PANKHURST
AND OTHERS.

Meetings.Location: New Constitutional Hall, Park Mansions Arcade
Meetings.Raw: TUESDAY, JANUARY 6, at 3 p.m., in the NEW CONSTITUTIONAL HALL, Park Mansions Arcade, Dr. Flora -- "Forcible Feeding and Its Effects." Mrs. Cecil Chapman. Chair, Mrs. Hartley.
Next meeting will take place there 2.30, Jan. 14.
for Mrs. MacKirdy's lecture at Prince Arthur Road Library on Wednesday, Jan. 21.
Speakers for public meeting at Drill Hall on Jan. 29 will shortly be announced.
Will members please remind working women of their meeting on Jan. 5 at Rainbow Hall, Silverhill, at 8 p.m.?
Members and friends are asked to come to Studio, 6, Stonard Road, on Wednesday evening, Jan. 7, 7.30 p.m.
Members who wish to attend Miss Ada Moore's elocution class on Monday, Jan. 19, 8.30 p.m., please send in their names soon.

Meetings.Location: Barry Road Wesleyan Church, East Dulwich
Meetings.Raw: During the morning service on December 21, at Barry Road Wesleyan Church, East Dulwich, a number of women in the congregation chanted a prayer on behalf of Mrs. Pankhurst while the Litany was being said.
Meeting at Fife Hall on Jan. 2, 8 p.m.
Members please note there will not be the usual rally on Jan. 3, but an open-air meeting will be held at Jones Bros. corner at 8 p.m.
The weekly "At Homes" will be resumed on Tuesday, Jan. 13, at shop.

Members are asked to note that a woman's meeting and tea will be held at shop on Wednesday, Jan. 7, 8.30 (at which Mrs. Beldon and Mrs. Best will speak), also a canvassers' meeting in connection with the same will be held on Friday, Jan. 7, at 6 p.m.
Miss Fairweather has kindly consented to lend drawing-room on Jan. 30.
Meeting on Common next Sunday, as usual.
Open-air meetings will recommence on Jan. 13.
